column4: is there anything I can do to encourage the installer to find my DVD drive it just booted off of?
detect it with what?
for what?
I'm trying to install the latest ubuntu from iso (alternative).. it booted, launched the installer, then said it couldn't mount my CD after detecting keyboard
any thoughts on that Seven_Six_Two
does it throw a specific error?
just says "Your installation CD couldn't be mounted"
mount -t iso9660 /dev/scd0 /cdrom/     returns a "invalid argument"
is it a pata drive?
I was pretty sure it was SATA.. let me crack open the case
yea it's sata
oh if you think it is, then that sounds right
there a solution?
/mount exists?
is that the command that the installer uses?
/mount? no..     I ran %  mount -t iso9660 /dev/scd0 /cdrom
can you do it with sudo?
I'm in the console during the installer.. there is no sudo
sorry to waste your time rdg, I'm not sure what could be happening. I have never used that installer.
no sweat and not a waste of time. any attempt at help is appreciated
np
